title: Cuda Ridge Wines 2015 Petit Verdot (Livermore Valley)
description: Extremely full bodied, this boisterous wine punches the palate with roasted herb and late-harvest-fruit flavors as well as some alcoholic heat. It feels big and tannic in texture.

title: Decibel 2016 Gimblett Gravels Malbec (Hawke's Bay)
description: You don't see Malbec in New Zealand often. This one, from the renowned soils of Hawke's Bay's Gimblett Gravels, exemplifies many typical characters of the variety: It's inky black in color with ripe, slightly soapy plum and blackberry notes along with plenty of vanillin oak. The medium-bodied palate is plump and fruity, with soft tannins and an easy-going quality that makes this a decent contender against Argentine counterparts.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Reserve Made With Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Reduced aromas of vitamins and orange juice lead to a pulpy, chunky palate that's medium bodied. Pineapple and citrus-peel flavors finish with tropical fruit notes and modest punchy acidity.

title: Château de Potiron 2013 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This wine, at nearly five years, is still dry and firm with tannins. It has a touch of juicy black-currant fruit as well as acidity. It needs to age further to soften and get away from the firm, extracted character.

title: Bodega Norton 2017 Britto Barrel Select Limited Edition Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)
description: The raw, crisp nose is peppery, while this wine feels lean, with grapefruit-like acidity. Flavors of white grapefruit and fennel are quick through the finish. The wine features a colorful label by Brazilian pop artist Romero Britto.

title: Brancott 2016 Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)
description: This is an opulent style dripping with buttered toast, ripe pear, flint and green vegetal notes. The palate is soft and creamy but not without acidity. It's hard not to get sucked into the glass.

title: Callaway 2014 Profonde Winemaker's Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Tar, stewed black fruits, dill and peppercorns show on the nose of this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot. Sour plum flavors meet with anise candies and potpourri spice on the sip.

title: Callaway 2014 Wild Yeast Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Freshly pressed berries and red currants lean more toward red than purple fruit on the nose of this bottling, which also offers licorice spice and a hint of funky game. The palate is a tad sour with underripe berries and plum rinds, and doesn't uphold the nose's promise.

title: Casas Del Mar NV Pinot Noir Sparkling (Cava)
description: Subtle aromas of squash and pumpkin open this brut rosé. A basic but honest palate displays good balance and health. Burnt orange and pink-grapefruit flavors finish steady, mild and reflective of a good but regular Pinot Noir-based Cava.

title: Hat Ranch 2016 Estate Grown Dry Rosé
description: A pretty pale-salmon color, the aromas are a mixture of funky, herbal and fruity. The palate meanwhile brings a sleek feel and it doesn't quite hold together.

title: Malvirà NV Rive Gauche Metodo Charmat Arneis (Vino Spumante)
description: This sparkling Arneis has aromas of mature yellow apple skin, acacia and dried apricot. The aromas carry over to the brisk palate along with an orange zest note.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Griva Vineyard Therese Vineyards Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Tightly wound aromas of lemongrass, oak and green fruit show on the restrained nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh with underripe grapefruit and orange flavors yet there's also a streak of warmer walnut, which makes for a slightly disjointed experience.

title: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of fruit from Elephant Mountain and Eagle Ranch vineyards, there's no mistaking the variety, with its notes of whole green peppers, herbs and dark berries. The concentration of flavors seems quite light, not entirely holding the palate together.

title: Reif Estate 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Niagara Peninsula)
description: There's nothing shy about this wine, which shows dark fruits, brown sugar and cold coffee extract in abundance. The tannins are rough and astringent, offering a rather rustic charm, with surprising concentration.

title: Roza Ridge 2015 Malbec (Rattlesnake Hills)
description: This wine brings unusual aromas of freshly chopped parsley, orange twist, plum and hickory smoke. The palate is light, fresh and tart, bringing a sense of elegance. Floral notes linger on the finish.

title: Ruta 22 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Ripe berry aromas are oaky, with raisiny notes. A big, broad palate is obtuse and tannic. This wine tastes mostly of oak, char and toast, with black-fruit notes lurking below deck. A wide, tannic, scratchy finish suggests burnt toast.

title: Sand Point 2015 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Peach and pear notes fill the aroma of this soft and extremely fruity wine, while the palate adds marshmallow and butter impressions. It's a soft, lightly sweet wine with low acdity.

title: Santa Julia 2017 [+] Malbec (Mendoza)
description: A deep purple color and foxy, grapy aromas form the greeting on this everyday Malbec. In the mouth, it's somewhat wiry and choppy. Plum and berry flavors are simple and forward, with an herbal note.

title: Séamus Wines 2014 Pearl Pinot Gris (Lodi)
description: This wine has an unusual amount of flavor concentration and body, and it's already well aged. Interesting to smell the honeysuckle and taste the peach and earth flavors while a rich texture grips the palate

title: Sentivo 2014 Grenache (El Dorado)
description: This is a full-bodied but not very concentrated wine that smells meaty and cherry-like, has mellow, mature spice flavors, a smooth, broad texture and slightly hot finish.

title: Truett Hurst 2015 The Fugitive Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a big, juicy and highly ripe red wine, simple in structure and tannin profile, its core of fruit a density of baked plum and cinnamon.

title: Volatus 2015 Cavu White (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 64% Viognier, 18% Grenache Blanc and 18% Roussanne starts with aromas of sour citrus and smoke, blending underripe tangerine, yellow peach and creamy pear. Apple rinds, nectarine and sweeter citrus elements show on the sip, which is a tad disjointed.

title: Cave Robert & Marcel 2014 Domaine de Peyanne Vieilles Vignes  (Saumur)
description: A small parcel of old vines is used to make this black-fruit-flavored wine. Its stalky texture and smoky character are well balanced with the richer backdrop of black currants. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Celene NV Celene Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)
description: This is a soft, creamy wine with great acidity and a lively aftertaste. It is perfumed, floral from the Muscadelle in the blend, giving a bright wine that is just right as an aperitif.

title: Celene NV Opale Blanc de Blancs  (Crémant de Bordeaux)
description: Lightly perfumed with Muscadelle, this crisp and creamy wine is refreshing, bright and fruity. Apple and creamy pear fruit are lifted by acidity. It's a bright aperitif style of wine.

title: Amisfield 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Otago)
description: This is a pungent, herbaceous wine in notes of tomato leaf, cabbage and limey citrus. The searing acidity on the palate is overwhelming. Without the fruit weight to back it up, it can be a challenge to drink unless you're a die hard acid hound.

title: Arrogant Frog 2016 Lily Pad Noir Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
description: Black cherry, boysenberry and blueberry aromas set the stage for this attractive, fruit-forward wine, carrying through from the bouquet to the lightweight palate. The fruit is hit by a touch of baking spice through the close, and framed by soft tannins that lend a subtle structure. Drink now.

title: Baron de Luze 2015  Bordeaux
description: This light and fruity wine is immediately accessible, ready to drink now. With its soft texture and ripe black-currant fruits, it is spicy, ripe and offers attractive final acidity.

title: Fautor 2016 310 Altitudine Chardonnay-Feteasca Regalã White (Moldova)
description: Aromas of citrus blossom, grapefruit pith and river rock lead to flavors of lemon curd and lime zest. The finish is crisp and clean in this blend of Chardonnay and Feteasca Regalã.

title: Goldwater 2014 Pinot Noir (Wairau Valley)
description: Medicinal characters combine with cedar, smoke and soapy red fruits in this medium-bodied wine. It's on the heavy side, with apparent oak influence and a rather overt simplicity.
